column4: I can't run my ubuntu. when I run my pc, it says there are no partitions. I try to use a live cd, however my ubuntu partition has been desappeared. what can I do?
Boot to a liveCD and see what is there, (or not there as the case may be).
windows partition are there. however ubuntu no. can I recover it?
: ls : cannot access /chroot no such file or directorie
df | pastebinit
I thought you just said they were in /chroot ?
where can I see /chroot? I'm a little noob
Sorry, I confused  you with another.      But if I were  you, I'd boot to a liveCD and see what is there, (or not there as the case may be).
and compdoc, on disk utility my ubuntu partition has been marked as free. swap appear correctly
Was this  previously a dual boot system?
Does MS Windows boot now?
grub is not working. it says there are no partitions, and I can't start OS
Can you boot to MS Windows?
no, cause grub open first
I suggest you  boot to a liveCD and see what is there, (or not there as the case may be).
Do you have a linux CD?
sudo fdisk -l
sudo fdisk -l | pastebinit
pastebinit is not installed
Use http://paste.ubuntu.com if you can not use pastebinit
http://paste.ubuntu.com/571757/
You are correct in thinking he deleted your Linux partition.  Looks like all that's left is the 2G swap partition.
Not much left to do but re-install.
ok. thanks ;)
